subject: Re: Whats your favourite example to demonstrate Test Driven Development
msgSnippet: ... Given the time you have, I have found that something like a static method that calculates factorial (or Fibonacci) is a great example. Everyone knows (or
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Mark Levison" <mlevison@...> wrote:
>
> At long last I'm giving a tutorial on test driven development on
> Wednesday and am looking for some interesting examples to demo test
> driven development. In 10-15 minutes what do you try and build? Any
> reason you choose it? Anything in particular you try to demonstrate?

Given the time you have, I have found that something like a static
method that calculates factorial (or Fibonacci) is a great example.
Everyone knows (or should know) what the method is supposed to do,
they can be implemented in different ways (e.g. loop or recursion) and
have some interesting corner cases (e.g. factorial(N) can be equal to
zero for large values of N if you use plain ol' ints.)

Kent Beck and I recorded a quick demo using TDD to implement
factorial. We also use JUnit Factory, but the bulk of the demo is
about TDD. You can find it at:

http://www.agitar.com/developers/junit_factory.html

Click on "Alberto Savoia and Kent Beck demonstrate JUnitFactory".

Alberto Savoia

http://www.junitfactory.com
Free JUnit characterization tests
